meanings.sent1: Playing outside all day outwearies me.
meanings.sent2: Running a marathon can outwearies even the fittest athletes.
meanings.sent3: Trying to catch a butterfly outwearies the energetic puppy.
meanings.sent4: The endless meetings outwearied the employees, draining their enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The constant studying for exams outwearies students, leaving them feeling drained.

meanings.definition: To wear out or become worn out
meanings.sent1: The old shoes outwearied quickly due to daily use.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the fabric of the sofa outwearies and loses its color.
meanings.sent3: The repeated washing outwearies the delicate lace curtains.
meanings.sent4: The constant friction outwearies the gears of the old clock, causing it to slow down.
meanings.sent5: The harsh weather conditions outwearied the wooden fence, causing it to splinter and weaken.
